required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Removal of Double Antibiotic Paste on Post Operative Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Different Methods of Removal of Double Antibiotic Paste as an Intracanal Medication on Post Operative Pain:a Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Recruited patients with necrotic pulp after application of double antibiotic paste are assigned to group (XP Endo Finisher file) and group( Passive ultrasonic irrigation) and group (conventional syringe irrigation with side vented needle) to remove intracanal medication and record postoperative pain afterwards.

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigator will recruit patients who are found eligible to the criteria, double antibiotic paste will be inserted inside the canals. After 7 days, patients will be randomly assigned to either removal of intracanal medication using, the XP-Endo Finisher file, passive ultrasonic irrigation (PUI) and conventional syringe irrigation with side vented needle.
After the visit, patients will be asked to record post operative pain by Visual Analog Scale)in a given sheet

primary_outcome.measure: change in post operative pain (Visual Analogue Scale)

arm_group.description: removal of double antibiotic paste intracanal medication with XP-endo Finisher file
removal of double antibiotic paste intracanal medication with passive ultrasonic irrigation
removal of double antibiotic paste intracanal medication with conventional syringe irrigation

intervention.intervention_name: double antibiotic paste with XP-endo Finisher file
intervention.description: XP-endo Finisher files (FKG Dentaire, La Chaux-de-Fonds, Switzerland). file will be used with an endodontic motor X-Smart (Dentsply Sirona, Ballaigues, Switzerland) in removal of double antibiotic paste

intervention.intervention_name: double antibiotic paste with Irrisafe Ultrasonic tip
intervention.description: passive ultrasonic irrigation (PUI) with an IrriSafe Ultrasonic tips (Acteon,France), which will be driven by an ultrasonic device (Newtron P5, Satelec, Acteongroup, Merignac, France) in removal of double antibiotic paste

intervention.intervention_name: double antibiotic paste with side vented needle
intervention.description: conventional syringe irrigation with side vented needle (prime Dent, India) in removal of double antibiotic paste

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Medically free patients.
- Patient's age between 20-50 years.
- Both sexes.
- Necrotic pulp as indicated by thermal or electric pulp testing.
- No history of previous endodontic treatment of the tooth.
- Enough crown structure for adequate isolation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy or lactation
- Medically compromised patients
- Previous endodontic therapy of the affected tooth.
- Teeth diagnosed with vital pulp.
- Teeth with periodontal pocket more than 3mm deep.
- Teeth with abnormal anatomy or calcified canals.
- Teeth with caries below the bony level (non-restorable tooth).
- Immature teeth with open apices.

overall_contact.last_name: Shaimaa Nasr El-din Abd El-Ghaffar, MsC

facility.name: Faculty of Oral and dental medicine, Minia University

reference.citation: Singh RD, Khatter R, Bal RK, Bal CS. Intracanal medications versus placebo in reducing postoperative endodontic pain--a double-blind randomized clinical trial. Braz Dent J. 2013;24(1):25-9.

results_reference.citation: Gondim E Jr, Setzer FC, Dos Carmo CB, Kim S. Postoperative pain after the application of two different irrigation devices in a prospective randomized clinical trial. J Endod. 2010 Aug;36(8):1295-301. doi: 10.1016/j.joen.2010.04.012. Epub 2010 Jun 19.
Sadaf D, Ahmad MZ. Factors associated with postoperative pain in endodontic therapy. Int J Biomed Sci. 2014 Dec;10(4):243-7.

responsible_party.investigator_title: PHD Candidate - Endodontic Department- Faculty of Dentistry
